FuncDef: The display nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist command displays blacklist entries about a new flow from the public network to the private network on a CPU.
CLIs: display nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the CPU ID of a service board. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 3.

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist slot 1 engine 0
ExtraInfo: When a new flow from the public network to the private network is attacked, run the display nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist command to view the IP addresses, port numbers, and protocol types of the attacker and victim.
